item.title: Quantitation of glucose using Cu₂O/Ag nanoparticles probe with a smartphone-controlled portable device
item.description: A single-step method combining material preparation and the actual glucose measurements via the in situ growth of Cu2O/Ag nanoparticles was reported. Mechanistically, I use glucose itself to reduce Cu2+ and Ag+ ions that are stabilized with 3-mercaptopropionic acid and bovine serum albumin under alkaline conditions to form Cu2O/Ag nanoparticles and produce a color change in solution due to plasmonic resonance at 400 nm, which can be related back to the concentration of glucose. This was also the research of my master thesis.

item.title: Quantitation of glucose through its manipulation of the growth of Cu₂O/Ag nanoparticles [Oral]
Removing mercury ions from polluted solution through poly-dopamine-modified Fe₃O₄ nanoparticles
item.description: In this study, I improved the production efficiency of Fe3O4 nanoparticles by using a novel microwave synthesizer. Also, by modifying a poly-dopamine layer on the surface of nanoparticles to increase the surface area of nanoparticles, I succeeded in enlarging the Hg2+ ions adsorption capacity and releasing efficiency under hydrochloric acid of poly-dopamine-modified Fe3O4 nanoparticles and maintaining the high magnetic property of the material. The magnetic property of poly-dopamine-modified Fe3O4 nanoparticles makes it eco-friendly to reuse the material.
